storyInfo: Four years ago, the Duke of Stafford incited an armed rebellion within Londinium, and during the chaos, Golding came to the aid of the wounded Heidi. Heidi was insistent on delivering intel out of the city.

attributes.content: Four Years Ago...
3:25 P.M. \ Overcast
Saint-Marsol's College, Auchterigg District of Londinium
Hey! Look, all the soldiers in Parliament Square, all the crossbows and cannons! You've got nowhere to run!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: *whimper*...
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Stop crying, you're not supposed to cry! Chin up! You're playing the King!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Um... I-I'll have you all killed! I-I've got my Kn... Knights of the Foyer!
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: It's the Knights of the Tower.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Most of them surrendered. And all the ones who won't give in will be like you soon. They'll be tried by us, and... the fiery rage of Londinium we represent.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: W-Who can try a king?
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Used to be nobody could, maybe nobody else in the future either.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: You're a dead-end, Your Majesty. You blocked Victoria's forward stride.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Every machine in the city stopped on your command, plus you wanted to take the daily bread away from all the suffering people, stealing every last penny out of their purses.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Our hands toil for nothing but tomorrow's sun. It's you and your greedy attendants that forced us... to stain ourselves in your blood!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Forward, soldiers! For Victoria!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Victoria...! I... I am Victoria... you insolents! Victoria won't pardon you for this, even if I become a s... s...
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: A specter! Speeec-teeer! First you run over to those steps, and then fall down, and then you say that!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Who's that running around the doorway here?
Ralph, Anna, you little pair of mischief-makers—
It's Miss Molly...
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: We were just getting to the most fun part! Anna, quick, get on the steps, we're going to do the hanging!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Hanging... hanging?!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Who taught you children such a cruel game?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: It's how the grown-ups in Slantwards Alley play.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Slantwards Alley... there's all manners there. Did you watch some kind of silly show? Who took you to see?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Tom the cobbler.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: He was drinking a lot of yellow stuff, and it was all dripping off his face. And then he ran up on stage while they were up there, and he was yelling and screaming 'I won't let you disgrace His Majesty the King, he was a great among greats.'
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: That bloody Tom! No, that's no language to use in front of children... Oh, what's he thinking, taking children to a pub?!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Let's keep going, Anna. I want to play one more time before supper.
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Then it's your turn to be the one that dies! Ralph, you promised! You can't fib!
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Oh, Your Majesty... pardon these children for disrespecting you.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: They've never seen you, nor heard your voice before. All they know are rumors of you from all the city's gossip peddlers.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Miss Molly, you've never seen the King before either! You don't get to be all hoity-toity with us!
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Come on, run, Anna, I'm chasing you—
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Out of the way, t... traitor! Sooner or later, you'll all be torn apart by the beasts within!
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Children, this is hardly proper of you.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: If you don't want punishment, you'd best cut that out. Never let any of the clergy or teachers see...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: See what?
Oh, good, Lady Golding!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Ralph, why are you so flushed?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Um, 'cuz... 'cuz...
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: We're playing a game, ma'am. It's really fun.
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: A game?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Very well, I understand. Return to your bedrooms soon, and don't forget to do today's homework.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Innocent Child

attributes.content: Additionally, Ralph, Molly may only be older than the two of you by a few years, but she is still your teacher.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am. Sorry, Miss Molly—
attributes.name: Naughty Child

attributes.content: Alright, alright, listen to the ma'am now. Off you go.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I can't believe you didn't scold the two of them.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Ralph and Anna? I don't blame them.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: The children just don't understand what cruelty is yet.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: They have an innate desire to learn. If they can't learn anything proper from books or ourselves, it's only natural they'll turn to other places.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: They... so many say that hanging transformed Victoria. Lady Golding, do you agree?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Ask the same question to different people, and you'll only get different answers.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: The machines of Highbury's munitions factories certainly never ceased to whir, but the grand houses of Auchterigg have had many a change in ownership.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: While all I know is that these poor children still come in droves to our school each year, bless their hearts. They're in need of help, much as I was twenty years ago.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I thank the school. If it hadn't lodged me, I would have long died of some illness or other.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Molly, what happened just earlier gave me an idea.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: An idea... You're mean, the sets of plays you're holding?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: So they're meant for the children. But they've only just learned to read. Won't it be a little too soon?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Better this than all the showy, slipshod stuff in Slantwards Alley.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: For young children, acting others' roles is tantamount to a game. The complex implications might escape them for now, but at least they can get a little taste of the emotion and power within the words for themselves.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I do hope you're right.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: It comes with another upside too, no? The children won't be nodding off in my literature classes anymore.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Haha, I suppose so. What matters to me is that we can use up just a little of their energy—it'll be a great relief for me!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Excuse me, madams, bookshop's closing in advance.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: Mr. Adams? You're quite early to shut today.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Haven't you heard yet, ma'am? There was a disturbance at the Duke's office in Camden this morning.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: Disturbance? What kind of disturbance is it to affect Auchterigg? It's quite a ways away.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: One of the office admins got beat to death. Duke of Stafford's nephew, apparently. Only just rocked up in Londinium a week ago.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: ...Oh, rest his soul. Have the police caught the murderer yet?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: That's the problem.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: Witnesses say the suspect scarpered into a Defense Force barracks.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: Seal the street! Move! Don't let him get away!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: All eyes out—
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: And now he's fled into Auchterigg? Really?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Hard to say, ma'am. Probably not that simple.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: How strange. Are these the Defense Force's men? My eyes might just be playing tricks, but their uniform seems a little different to what I remember...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I've got a friend who lives in Camden, ma'am. He says there's soldiers just flooding the street nearby, all of them wearing that uniform.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: There's even word that... well...
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: A duke secretly slipped into Londinium just yesterday!
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: How, though? Wasn't that prohibited by law?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Thank you, Mr. Adams. These books are too heavy; I'll pick them up next time.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Molly. Back to the school, as quick as we can.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: No one? Didn't they say they saw someone hiding in the alley?
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: We can't let word of the Duke spread in the city! If we do, our entire operation today's... ugh, damn and blast!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier
Victorian Soldier
attributes.content: Didn't even see if it was a man or a woman. What the hell are these intelligence agents doing in their bloody Londinium offices?

attributes.name: Victorian Soldier
attributes.content: Good-for-nothings! Got the Duchy's people running circles around them!
Lucky I just landed a bolt—
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Keep up the chase! They can't have gotten far!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Wait—
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Lady Golding? Did you see something?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Nothing urgent.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Molly, you go back to the school for now. Gather all the children, and make sure they don't stray out into the streets.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I'm going to see a friend. Prepare some hot water and a clean towel in the office for me; I'll be back as soon as I can.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Rrmph... *pant*...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Sorry, bear with me. School things are fairly rudimentary—more often we have children falling over while making a racket. Not so much being shot by soldiers' crossbows.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Who knew... you could sew up wounds.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: With the scant yearly donations to the school, we can't afford to hire that many staff. I have to moonlight as the school nurse a lot of the time.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Urrrgh... ow...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: After seeing you move so silently on the street, I wasn't imagining you would feel the pain.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Oh, don't jest with me... you're the only one in all of Londinium who I can truly catch my breath with.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I can suture your wound, Heidi, but I can't disinfect it. You'd best be off to a hospital straight away.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I don't think so.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Can you tell me why?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I thought we were friends.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Golding, I shouldn't have come here with you in the first place. I haven't wanted to pull you or the children into all the mess.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: So the soldiers are after you. Are they really the Duke of Stafford's men?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Did Adams tell you that...? I thought he would keep mum.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: He's your friend, and mine as well. He was the one holding the book club we met each other at, and don't you forget that.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Ha, ha. Could I ever?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You were a ruthless one then.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: 'A fast-food work of pop-culture subservience.'—'Its only use is fueling chatter between ladies of the house and girls at teatime.' Your words for my newest work.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: But I did say that the author's talent lay far beyond.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: And I hadn't conceived that the most tasteful of all Londinium's critics was such a simple, unassuming teacher.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I could read into every line you'd written, and for each one, the hundred lines you hadn't besides—those were your words, Heidi, uttered by you.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Never would I doubt the unspoken understanding between us.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Then let me help you.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: We can be more frank with each other, Heidi... just as we always have.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Golding... did I ever tell you that, years and years ago, I had the fortune of meeting a Laterano cleric who wasn't a Sankta?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: She once lived in Londinium too. She may well have some ties to this school's origin.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Who is she?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: She's...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Lady Golding, goodness!
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Oh, hold on, you have a guest? Wh—Who might this be...?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: A literary circle friend.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Is something the matter, Molly?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Outside, ma'am... I thought you would've heard...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: From far away come strange noises.
The sort that Londiniers are quite inured to.
They confuse them all too easily, at first, with the sound of an exploding steam boiler carelessly lit, or the sound of the mechanical fowlbeasts the children so love slicing through the air.
But as the ground and building tremors become steadily apparent, an instinctual panic strikes everyone.

By protection of the kings, Londinium has never once met Catastrophe before. What they face now is without a doubt a different sort of menace—and in those of long age, something stirs. The nightmare of twenty years ago has come again.
The sign of war.
In the midst of the room's silence, the rumble grows thicker.
It doesn't make sense.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: They were only catching a few criminals. Why'd they bring out such a display of force?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: If we could make sense of every thought in the minds of our fellow man, many a tragedy would never come to pass.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Molly, if you could check whether the soldiers in the street are still there.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I have to leave now.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I know. I'd love to urge you to stay, but I know full well that not even heavy artillery could stop you.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I know you've noticed too, Golding. Another scene change is being wrought upon Londinium tonight.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The Duke of Stafford's troops are on the offensive at Parliament Square as we speak. The Duke of Cavendish's men arrived at the outer wall a long time earlier.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The coup d'état over twenty years ago, and the turmoil it brought, were at least the briefest thing for the citizens here. But this time... I couldn't say.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: This will likely develop into an inter-ducal war, and its epicenter will have been Londinium.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I've... come into some intel. It has the potential to save tens of thousands of lives. The sort of thing I need to deliver out of the city before tomorrow's daybreak.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: ...War, you say.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I'm afraid so.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The fire of war could spread to other cities at a moment's notice. Every Victorian needs to make preparations.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Victoria's peace has endured for over two decades since His Majesty's passing. Many call it a miracle, but I long ceased to believe it a miracle of any sort.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: No one would abandon their own interest, especially when its vastness is that of Victoria's... It instead gave those with the stuff to plunder it all the more to consider.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: We pitiful that live in this crack of history could only simply shut our eyes and proclaim it so. 'Peace.'
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Heh... who would've thought deathly illness would drive Stafford to such measures? And who could've predicted how the other dukes would respond?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Without the efforts of people such as yourself, this war would've broken out twenty-two years ago, instead of being delayed to today.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Are you trying to soothe me, Golding?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I'm only stating the reality, nothing more.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: You needn't reveal your goals to me, Heidi, let alone explain what your people have been planning all these years.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: You need only answer me one thing—will peace come again?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: ...It will.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: That's what we've been striving for all along.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: We will protect our homeland. That is the truth, throughout the ages, that we Victorians have believed in.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Even if countless will die in the streets outside? Even if, with each end in sight upon the road of yours, the next preordained war comes to greet you?
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Because war will ultimately end. It may end at the hands of us, or our posterity. When the smoke clears from the skies shrouding Victoria, no more will the children's smiles be crossed with haze.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: I'm willing to believe in you, Heidi, to try and believe.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: Should I ever be able to return to Londinium, Golding... then I'll tell you everything, when we meet again.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Remember that. Remember your promise.
attributes.name: Golding

attributes.content: ...Come back alive.
attributes.name: Golding
